title: Ryu Hyun-jin Among Finalists for MLB Comeback Player Award
text:
Ryu Hyun-jin of the Los Angeles Dodgers has been named a finalist for the Comeback Player honor in this year's Players Choice Awards.

The Major League Baseball Players Association on Monday announced three finalists each from the American League and the National League.

Along with Ryu, Atlanta Braves third baseman Josh Donaldson and Cincinnati Reds pitcher Sonny Gray were selected as finalists in the National League.

"Ryu was named the Opening Day starter (following a series of injuries to his teammates) and never looked back. He tied for the 10th-longest streak of consecutive scoreless innings (31) in Dodgers history and was named the NL All-Star Game starter after going 5-0 with a 0.59 ERA in May. He finished with a 14-5 score and an MLB-best 2.32 ERA," the MLBPA wrote on its website.

The association has recognized "the on-field and off-field achievements of their peers through the Players Choice Awards" since 1992.

This year's winners will be announced next week, and they will receive grants of US$20,000 each from the MLB Players Trust to direct to a charity of their choice.
